snippet: One of the most violent on-ice events in N.H.L. history seemed headed to resolution, as lawyers prepared a settlement to a $68 million lawsuit brought by Steve Moore against Todd Bertuzzi, who attacked him during a game in 2004.
abstract: Lawyers prepare out-of-court settlement to $68 million lawsuit brought by former Colorado Avalanche hockey player Steve Moore against Todd Bertuzzi, Vancouver Canucks player who attacked him during game and ended his career; terms of settlement are not disclosed, but if deal is reached it will avoid civil trial scheduled to begin in Toronto.
lead_paragraph: One of the most violent on-ice events in N.H.L. history seemed headed to resolution, as lawyers prepared a settlement to a $68 million lawsuit brought by Steve Moore against Todd Bertuzzi, who attacked him during a game in 2004.

headline.main: Settlement May Be Near in Career-Ending Attack That Has Shadowed N.H.L.
headline.print_headline: Settlement May Be Near in Career-Ending Attack That Has Shadowed N.H.L.
